title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4210.1 - Purpose and general description
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4210.1 - Purpose and general description

State Regulations

The purpose of this Part is to set forth the application
process, determine eligibility and codify administration by the corporation for
the Small- and Medium-Sized Business Assistance Program authorized by the

Omnibus Economic Development Act of 1987, chapter 839 of the Laws of 1987. The
purpose of the program is to provide financial assistance to small- and
medium-sized businesses to facilitate the retention, promotion, development and
diversification of these businesses, the reduction of the costs of business and
production for such enterprises, the expansion of employment opportunities, the
expansion of existing small- and medium-sized industrial enterprises, and the
location in the State of additional small- and medium-sized industrial
enterprises. The program will also seek to establish affirmative action goals
for participation in projects by minorities and women. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4210.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
